achievements: Reduced batch processing time by 600 minutes through pipeline parallelization and query optimization, improving timeliness of downstream reports.
Led delivery of multiple high-traffic APIs with 99.9% uptime by introducing observability and resiliency patterns.
Mentored engineers to adopt testing and CI best practices, improving deployment confidence and reducing rollbacks.
selected_projects: Project Alpha: built a microservice handling 1M+ requests/day with robust observability and caching.
Project Beta: optimized ETL pipelines, achieving a 30% performance improvement in data processing.

projects.title: Project Alpha
projects.description: Designed and implemented a high-throughput Go microservice that handles over one million daily requests, using efficient concurrency patterns, caching, and autoscaled deployments to maintain low latency and high availability.
bullets: Implemented Redis-backed caching and request deduplication to reduce backend load and improve p99 latency.
Introduced end-to-end tracing and load-testing which guided performance tuning under production traffic.

projects.title: Project Beta
projects.description: Optimized large-scale ETL data pipelines by reworking batching, parallelism, and Postgres queries, reducing processing time by roughly 30% and improving data freshness for analytics consumers.
bullets: Streamlined ETL stages and implemented backpressure handling to stabilize processing under peak loads.
Added data integrity checks and retries to improve pipeline reliability and reduce manual intervention.
